title: Workday Names Gerrit Kazmaier President, Product and Technology
text: Former Google and SAP Executive Joins Workday to Lead Global Innovation Strategy Sayan Chakraborty to Retire from Workday After a Decade of Transformative Leadership PLEASANTON, Calif. , Feb. 25, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Workday, Inc. (NASDAQ: WDAY), the AI platform for managing people and money , today announced the appointment of Gerrit Kazmaier to the role of president, product and technology.

text: WDAY introduces a cutting edge solution to streamline AI management across organizations' operations.

title: The Next Generation of Workforce Management is Here--Workday Unveils New Agent System of Record
text: New Capabilities Powered by Workday Illuminate™ Will Provide a Centralized System for Managing an Organization's Entire Fleet of AI Agents, From Workday and Third Parties Alike Workday is Leveraging Its 20 Years of Leadership in Human Capital Management to Empower Organizations to Thrive in the World of Agentic AI and Manage the Changing Workforce Workday Announces New Role-Based Illuminate Agents for Payroll, Contracts, Financial Auditing, and Policy Companies Will be Able to Discover and Deploy AI Agents From Workday, Customers, and Partners Through Workday Marketplace PLEASANTON, Calif. , Feb. 11, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Workday, Inc.  (NASDAQ: WDAY), the AI platform for managing people and money , today announced the Workday Agent System of Record to help organizations manage their entire fleet of AI agents – from Workday and third-parties alike – in one place.

title: Workday Named Best in KLAS for ERP (Large) for the Eighth Consecutive Year
text: PLEASANTON, Calif. , Feb. 10, 2025 /PRNewswire/ --  Workday, Inc.  (NASDAQ: WDAY), a leading provider of solutions to help organizations manage their people and money , today announced that KLAS Research  named Workday as Best in KLAS 2025 in enterprise resource planning (ERP) for large organizations for the eighth year in a row.

title: Workday layoffs: HR enterprise software maker is cutting hundreds of jobs amid AI push
text: It's been a rough week for the tech industry. First, Salesforce announced it would lay off more than 1,000 employees, and now another enterprise software maker has announced even deeper job cuts.

title: Workday to Lay Off 1,750 Employees as Part of Restructuring Plan
text: Workday (WDAY) announced in a regulatory filing Wednesday that it plans to lay off approximately 1,750 employees, or 8.5% of its workforce, as part of a restructuring plan.

title: Workday to cut 8.5% of its workforce
text: Payroll processor Workday will cut around 1,750 jobs, or 8.5%, of its current workforce, it said in a filing on Wednesday.

title: Workday Announces Date of Fiscal 2025 Fourth Quarter and Full Year Financial Results
text: PLEASANTON, Calif. , Feb. 4, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Workday, Inc. (NASDAQ: WDAY), a leading provider of solutions to help organizations manage their people and money, plans to announce its fiscal 2025 fourth quarter and full year financial results after market close on Tuesday, February 25, 2025.

title: With Workday Leaning Into AI, Is Its Turnaround Working? Should Investors Buy the Stock Right Now?
text: With shares trading slightly below where they finished trading at toward the end of 2021, Workday (WDAY 1.06%) needs to reinvigorate its stock price. Its shares got a boost following the software-as-a-service (SaaS) company's Q4 reports and guidance as it leans into artificial intelligence (AI) to help drive growth.
